events.name: Women Techmakers Ladies Night: Opening Event and Holiday Social
events.description:
Join us on December 11th for our first Women Techmakers Event in Bozeman!

Our goal is to create an inclusive community to help support, grow, and connect women in tech in Gallatin County. Come enjoy complimentary wine and accompaniments while you meet your future WTM chapter. We will kick off at 6pm with a short presentation about WTM and GDG and discuss our community interest, and end with time to socialize and network with other women in the community.

Please share with all the tech ladies in your life!

Can't make the meetup? You can still help us grow our community by filling out this form! https://goo.gl/forms/2f9QRsGgGYaKGqcq2

events.name: WTM Networking & Social Night
events.description:
Let's kick off 2019 with a chance to get to know each other and maybe share some goals, ideas, or wishes for what the group does this coming year. Come hang out and get to know your fellow Women Techmakers in the Bozeman community!

This event is pay your own way if you want any food or libations, but it's a great time to take advantage of Blend's Ladies Night specials!

events.name: WTM International Women's Day Bozeman Summit 2019
events.description:
Women Techmakers is a global program created and sponsored by Google. Our goal is to encourage, grow, and support women in the tech industry by creating these local communities through Google Developer Groups.

Every year for International Women's Day, these local communities host Women Techmakers Summits to bring women in their local communities together. We will be hosting a full-day conference at the Rialto Theatre for our local chapter.

Please join us for the Women Techmakers Bozeman Summit on Friday, March 8th, 2019!

Registration is open through March 1, 2019.

Visit https://wtmbozeman.com/ for more information.

events.name: WTM Spring Social
events.description:
Due to our small side quest at the International Women's Day Summit, we are making up our missed cocktail networking hour with a spring social! Come to network, chat, or just meet some new friends. All tech or tech-adjacent roles are welcome to attend!

Complimentary light appetizers and beverages will be served. This event is casual and you are welcome to attend for all or part of the evening.

Didn't make it to the summit? We'd still love to have you! This event is free to those who attended the IWD Summit and $10 for non-attendees. Please bring *cash* to pay at the door.

Please RSVP if you plan to attend so we can have an accurate headcount for food and beverage purposes. (Guests are also welcome if they are not on Meetup, but please indicate how many and they will need to pay the $10 non-attendee fee as well.)

events.name: WTM You're Worth It - Confidence Workshop
events.description:
Be Fierce. Be Fearless. Be Confident.
Build confidence by learning the power of confident communication through body language and the words we use.

In this interactive workshop, you will:
- Apply your growth mindset to your confidence
- Discover what confidence is and isnâ€™t (and how to feel more confident)
- Practice more confident communication (body language, verbal language)

Approximate itinerary:
* 5:30 pm - Arrival & network (complimentary drinks & snacks provided by Advice Pay)
* 6:00 pm - You're Worth It Confidence Clinic (facilitated by Hannah Bratterud & Tessa Witmer)
* 7:00 pm - Networking
* 7:30 pm - Close

NOTE: This event is free but it is limited to 35 participants. Please RSVP no later than 5:00pm on **MAY 31** to confirm your spot!

events.name: WTM Fall Social
events.description:
Happy fall! Hope you all had amazing summers and are ready to get together again.

Join us at AdvicePay downtown for a casual gathering; no specific itinerary just a great chance to hang out with other lady* technologists. Bring yourselves, your friends, and your ideas for this coming Meetup season!

Complimentary drinks & snacks provided by our amazing hosts, AdvicePay.

NEED CHILDCARE? AdivcePay is generously offering donation-based childcare for a total of 8 kids! If this is something you would like to take advantage of, please include how many children you'll be bringing and their ages in your RSVP, or message me (Lindsey) separately.

Note: This event is free but please RSVP to help us with food and beverage quantities. :)

*We are a trans-inclusive space!

events.name: WTM - StrengthsFinder 2.0 Workshop
events.description:
What if, rather than focusing on what you could improve about yourself, you instead focused on your natural talents? Imagine if you could recognize what already makes you great, and harness that greatness to do amazing things! In less than an hour, the StrengthsFinder assessment helps you determine your top 5 strengths!

For our November gathering, weâ€™re going to focus on our strengths! Before joining us, please allot about 1 hour to complete the following:
---> RSVP to this Meetup!
---> Order the StrengthsFinder 2.0 book (see below), which comes with associated unique assessment code.
*** Reading the book is not necessary for the event, but taking the assessment is required. ***
---> Once your book arrives, take the online assessment; no preparation is needed and it typically takes less than one hour. Upon completion, you'll be provided with your top 5 strengths.
---> Submit your top 5 strengths to this form on or before Monday, November 11th: https://forms.gle/LDK9Mam6wFoU7xFVA

We'll gather information about everyone's strengths and then discuss over light appetizers and beverages at the Dataminr office (above ShirtWorks).

Hope to see you there!

NOTE: This event is limited to 15 attendees (plus 2 hosts). If your situation changes and you can no longer make it, please update your RSVP to allow someone to take your spot!

------------------------
The book and associated assessment code can be purchased on Amazon and is currently about $15.00 (hint: there's a chance your employer may be willing to purchase it for you):
https://www.amazon.com/StrengthsFinder-2-0-Tom-Rath/dp/159562015X/ref=tmm_hrd_swatch_0?_encoding=UTF8&qid=&sr=

organizers.name: Lindsey H.
organizers.bio: Currently a senior software engineer at Workiva, and a runner and baker in my free time.
